alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:48PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Surry and southwestern Patrick Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 948 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cana, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Airy... Flat Rock... Ararat... Woodville... Toast... and Westfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
